intro: Lithospermum breviflorum var. punctulatum, commonly known as the dotted lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, violet to blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with distinct glandular dots, giving it its common name. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes.
